abstract: Signs of personal splurging by traders and executives has rebounded from the doldrums of the financial crisis.
snippet: Signs of personal splurging by traders and executives has rebounded from the doldrums of the financial crisis.
lead_paragraph: Exuberance made a comeback this year at Josh Koplewicz’s annual Halloween party. More than 1,000 people packed into a 6,000-square-foot space at the Good Units night club in Manhattan, a substantially larger crowd than in the last several years. The open bar was sponsored by Russian Standard vodka, and Mr. Koplewicz, an investment analyst at Goldman Sachs, was able to snag a big headliner: the hip-hop star Lil’ Kim, who performed dressed in a black cat costume.

headline.main: With a Swagger, Wallets Out, Wall Street Dares to Celebrate
headline.print_headline: With a Swagger, Wallets Out, Wall Street Dares to Celebrate

byline.original: By Susanne Craig and Kevin Roose
